data.title: Verifying Atomic Orbitals
data.statement:
You are given a set of orbitals separated by spaces, for example, ```|^v| |^^|^v|v^|``` where each orbital is a compartment containing two characters surrounded by vertical pipes (up arrow, down arrow or an underscore for each character) and you need to verify if such a combination is valid. Since there are several factors to consider, in this clash, you will only be dealing with one of them:

You need to check if the arrows in each orbital have opposite signs if there are two of them in an orbital, else it can be ignored.
If yes, print {{Correct}}, else print the orbital(s) which violate the principle.

Unfilled spaces in the orbitals are marked by underscores for easier parsing.

<<Extra info: >> Orbital combinations such as "_^" and "_v" will not occur in the tests or validators.
data.stubGenerator:
read orbitals:string(100)
write Are the orbitals valid?
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A line [[orbitals]] giving a set of orbital groups separated by spaces
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A line saying {{Correct}} if the orbitals are valid, else the orbital(s) which are invalid separated by spaces.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a set of orbitals separated by spaces, for example, 
|^v| |^^|^v|v^|
 where each orbital is a compartment containing two characters surrounded by vertical pipes (up arrow, down arrow or an underscore for each character) and you need to verify if such a combination is valid. Since there are several factors to consider, in this clash, you will only be dealing with one of them:

You need to check if the arrows in each orbital have opposite signs if there are two of them in an orbital, else it can be ignored.
If yes, print Correct, else print the orbital(s) which violate the principle.

Unfilled spaces in the orbitals are marked by underscores for easier parsing.

Extra info:  Orbital combinations such as "_^" and "_v" will not occur in the tests or validators.




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A line orbitals giving a set of orbital groups separated by spaces

   

   

      
Output

      
Line 1: A line saying Correct if the orbitals are valid, else the orbital(s) which are invalid separated by spaces.

   

   

      
Constraints

      

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
|^_| |^v|^^|v^|

         

         

            
Output

            
^^
